subject: Art & Design
title: World Cinema: Stories Beyond Hollywood
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on World Cinema: Stories Beyond Hollywood.

hook.text: Parasite won Best Picture at the Oscars. A Korean film. In Korean. Hollywood's wall cracked open.

buildup.text: World cinema encompasses every national film tradition outside Hollywood: Indian, Nigerian, Iranian, Korean.

discovery.text: Bollywood produces over 1,500 films per year â€” more than Hollywood. Nollywood in Nigeria isn't far behind.

twist.text: Many acclaimed 'Hollywood' techniques originated abroad: jump cuts (France), long takes (Hungary), handheld (Denmark).

climax.text: Streaming gave global cinema direct access to worldwide audiences. Subtitles are no longer a barrier.

punchline.text: The best film in the world might not be in your language. Watch it anyway.

quiz.question: Which country produces more films per year than Hollywood?
options: Both India and Nigeria outpace Hollywood
